channel.title: Help!
channel.description: When I try to open my client or server, or my source, it says "Java is not recognized as an internal or external command Operable program, or batch file" How do I fix this ;~;

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You didn’t set them correctly than.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @I_Eat_Nubs I Eat Nubs
item.description:
@I_Eat_Nubs wrote:

Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get 'The path is not yet specified' so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open 'My Computer' and click 'View System Information'. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says 'Advanced' and at the bottom, click 'Environmental Variables'. Now what you're going to do, is go to your 'Path' and 'Classpath' variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, you’re going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;

Code: [Select]
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the ‘jdk1.6.0_11’ to the newest version.

After you have done the Classpath variable, you’re going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

Code: [Select]
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;


I did all that, it still says ‘Java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
Operable program or batch file.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Set your environmental variables. There’s a segment in this thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @I_Eat_Nubs I Eat Nubs
item.description:
@I_Eat_Nubs wrote:

@echo off
title 530 client
java -xmx256m clientloader 25
@pause

Thats the client, Which doesn’t work.

The server doesn’t work either, it reads the same error.
Whats wrong? I’m using windows 7.

Read full topic
